Y. Yang, M. Q.-H. Meng, and K. K. Tan. Adaptive sliding mode control for uncertain systems. Automatica, 43(2):201–207, 2007. Adaptive SMC with online uncertainty estimation for robustness. doi:10.1016/j.automatica.2006.08.017.

Numerical Methods¶

Runge-Kutta integration, stiff ODE solvers, and numerical stability analysis.

[AP98]

Uri M. Ascher and Linda R. Petzold. Computer Methods for Ordinary Differential Equations and Differential-Algebraic Equations. Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics, Philadelphia, PA, 1998. ISBN 978-0898714128. Chapter 5: Stability of Multistep Methods - A-stability, L-stability, Dahlquist barrier. doi:10.1137/1.9781611971392.

[But03]

J. C. Butcher. Numerical Methods for Ordinary Differential Equations. John Wiley & Sons, second edition, 2003. ISBN 978-0-471-96758-3. URL: https://doi.org/10.1002/0470868279, doi:10.1002/0470868279.

[But16]

John C. Butcher. Numerical Methods for Ordinary Differential Equations. John Wiley & Sons, Chichester, UK, 3 edition, 2016. ISBN 978-1119121503. Chapter 3: Runge-Kutta Methods - Dormand-Prince RK45 method. doi:10.1002/9781119121534.

[HNW93]

Ernst Hairer, Syvert P. Nørsett, and Gerhard Wanner. Solving Ordinary Differential Equations I: Nonstiff Problems. Springer-Verlag, Berlin, 2 edition, 1993. ISBN 978-3540566700. Chapter II: Runge-Kutta and Extrapolation Methods - order conditions for explicit RK. doi:10.1007/978-3-540-78862-1.

[HW96]

Ernst Hairer and Gerhard Wanner. Solving Ordinary Differential Equations II: Stiff and Differential-Algebraic Problems. Springer-Verlag, Berlin, 2 edition, 1996. ISBN 978-3540604525. Chapter IV: Stiff Problems - One-Step Methods, characterization of stiffness. doi:10.1007/978-3-642-05221-7.

[PTVF07]

William H. Press, Saul A. Teukolsky, William T. Vetterling, and Brian P. Flannery. Numerical Recipes: The Art of Scientific Computing. Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, UK, 3 edition, 2007. ISBN 978-0521880688. Chapter 17: Integration of Ordinary Differential Equations - Runge-Kutta methods. URL: https://numerical.recipes/.

Software & Tools¶

Python scientific computing libraries and numerical computation frameworks.

[ESR25]

S. Ekanathan, O. Smith, and C. Rackauckas. A fully adaptive radau method for the efficient solution of stiff ordinary differential equations at low tolerances. arXiv preprint - Adaptive Radau IIA for stiff ODE integration with sliding mode dynamics, 2025. URL: https://arxiv.org/abs/2501.05125.

[H+24a]

Charles R. Harris and others. NumPy 1.26.0: the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python. 2024. Release 1.26.0. URL: https://github.com/numpy/numpy, doi:10.1038/s41586-020-2649-2.

[H+24b]

Charles R. Harris and others. NumPy 1.26.0: the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python. 2024. Release 1.26.0. URL: https://github.com/numpy/numpy, doi:10.1038/s41586-020-2649-2.

[RKR08]

H. Raichle, C. Kanzow, and P. Rentrop. On the numerical solution of stiff odes arising in sliding mode control. Automatica, 44(12):3078–3083, 2008. Numerical integration methods for stiff ODE systems in sliding mode control. doi:10.1016/j.automatica.2008.05.019.

[V+24a]

Pauli Virtanen and others. SciPy 1.11.0: fundamental algorithms for scientific computing. 2024. Release 1.11.0. URL: https://github.com/scipy/scipy.

[V+24b]

Pauli Virtanen and others. SciPy 1.11.0: fundamental algorithms for scientific computing. 2024. Release 1.11.0. URL: https://github.com/scipy/scipy.

Citation Usage in Documentation¶

To cite a reference in your documentation, use the {cite} role:

See {cite}`smc_utkin_1992_sliding_modes` for the original sliding mode formulation.

Multiple citations: {cite}`pso_kennedy_1995_particle_swarm_optimization,pso_clerc_2002_particle_swarm`

Example output:

See [Utk92] for the original sliding mode formulation.

BibTeX Source Files¶

The bibliography is generated from the following BibTeX files:

  • refs.bib - Main bibliography

  • bib/smc.bib - Sliding mode control references

  • bib/pso.bib - PSO optimization references

  • bib/stability.bib - Lyapunov and stability theory

  • bib/adaptive.bib - Adaptive control theory

  • bib/fdi.bib - Fault detection and isolation

  • bib/numerical.bib - Numerical methods and integration

  • bib/software.bib - Software and tools

  • bib/dip.bib - Double inverted pendulum references

All BibTeX files are located in the docs/ and docs/bib/ directories.
